Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial on the Efficacy of Cricoid Pressure during Rapid Sequence Induction

Participants.evidence: 40 participants undergoing elective surgery requiring general anaesthesia

Intervention.evidence: cricoid pressure (n=20) or simulated cricoid pressure (n=20)

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the prevalence of aspiration

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was conducted using a computer-generated sequence, and allocation was concealed using sealed envelopes

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was applied to outcome assessors

Number_Randomised.evidence: cricoid pressure (n=20) or simulated cricoid pressure (n=20)

Result_Outcome.evidence: The study found no significant difference in the primary outcome between the cricoid pressure and control groups

Harms.evidence: No adverse events were reported in either group
